title: The Kleebob Card Game
description: A door-to-door book salesman finds Gracie to be a tough customer; George and Harry try to get out of going to the movies by teaching their wives a confusing card game they invented for that purpose called "Kleebob."

title: Gracie the Artist
description: After briefly discussing reaction to the first Burns and Allen telecast, George steps aside as Gracie visits an art museum and immediately decides that she will become a painter. In the middle of the show the dance team of Fosse and Niles do a number.

title: The Property Tax Assessor
description: George Burns delivers a monologue on how he met Gracie while she bollixes the tax assessor and frustrates George and Harry with their football knowledge.

title: Harry Morton's Private Secretary
description: Blanche Morton becomes jealous when her husband, Harry, hires a new secretary because she assumes his new assistant is female. Meanwhile, a pretty high school student drops by the Burns home to interview George for her high school newspaper, Blanche and Gracie assume that the girl is the person Harry just hired.

title: Gracie's Checking Account
description: George's banker persuades him to cancel Gracie's checking account. Meanwhile, a traffic cop tries to give Gracie a ticket for running red lights.

title: Gracie's Christmas
description: At Christmas, Gracie tells about the Christmases she had as a child.

title: Rumba Lessons
description: Before the Mortons and Burnses go to a party, Gracie hires an Arthur Murray dance instructor to teach George and Harry how to dance. The boys beg off, citing "old football injuries" until they see the beautiful female dance instructor who will conduct the lesson.

title: Happy Hmm Hmm
description: Gracie discovers that today's date is circled on her calendar, but she doesn't remember why. She assumes she's supposed to throw a party.

title: To Go or Not to Go
description: George and Harry Morton want to go duck hunting, but Gracie and Blanche want to go to Palm Springs.

title: Gracie and the St. Bernard
description: Gracie finds a stray St. Bernard dog so she brings him home. She tries to teach him tricks, such as how to fetch George's golf clubs which displeases George.

title: Holding Out
description: When Blanche discovers that Harry has been holding out money from his paycheck to go to the racetrack, she leaves him and stays with the Burnses.

title: The Income Tax Man
description: George's accountant can't grasp Gracie's proposed tax deductions.

title: The Vanderlips' Dinner Party
description: The Vanderlips are having a dinner party, but have not invited Blanche and Harry.

title: Johnny Velvet's Day in Court
description: Gracie witnesses an car accident that involves gangster Johnny Velvet. Velvet and his attorney try to intimidate Gracie into testifying in his favor.

title: George is Sick
description: George is sick. People keep bringing him food to help him gain strength and recover.

title: Teenage Girl Spends the Weekend
description: The Vanderlips are going out of town for a few days, so Gracie volunteers to let their teenage daughter Emily stay with her and George during that time. Emily soon gets an interesting lesson when Gracie "helps" her with her schoolwork.

title: The Andersons Move In
description: Harry Morton sells a lot in the neighborhood to some out-of-state people.

title: The Vanderlips' Costume Party
description: The Vanderlips plan to throw a lavish costume party, and Gracie looks to travel brochures to get some "ideas" for costumes for she and George.

title: Mamie Kelly Gets Stuck
description: Gracie's friend Mamie Kelly comes to visit and overstays her welcome because she keeps missing the various modes of transportation out of the city.

title: To Fish or Not to Fish
description: Harry Morton would rather go fishing than visit Blanche's mother.

title: Too Much of the Mortons
description: George comes to the conclusion that he and Gracie are seeing too much of the Mortons. He devises a plan to trick Blanche and Harry to go out of town for the weekend so he and Gracie can use the Mortons' pool by themselves. Complications ensue.

title: Silky Thompson Moves to Beverly Hills
description: A petition is circulated to prevent gangster Silky Thompson from moving into George and Gracie's neighborhood - and after spending some time with Gracie, Thompson signs it himself.

title: Gracie's Vegetarian Plot
description: Gracie and Blanche read a diet book. They invite the author to speak at the meeting of their club, the Beverly Hills Uplifters Society. Gracie and Blanche are so inspired by the speech that they serve their husbands nothing but vegetables.

title: Space Patrol Kids Visit
description: George's attempts to write a speech are interrupted by the Mortons, Harry and Mamie's children who, as Space Patrol cadets are constantly attacking "the Earthman" with their toy blasters.

title: Buying Wholesale
description: Harry Morton has a real-estate client who sells appliances. Harry tells Gracie that she can order things through him wholesale. George makes her take the appliances back, so she buys the same items-retail.

title: Gracie Gives a Wedding
description: Gracie organizes a wedding for a woman in the Burns's living room.

title: Gracie Goes to a Psychiatrist
description: Blanche plans to see a psychiatrist because she's been plagued by nightmares, but when she chickens out, Gracie waltzes into the office pretending to be Blanche. Befuddled, the doctor contacts Harry to tell him his wife's insane.

title: The Beverly Hills Uplift Society
description: The Beverly Hill Uplift Society no longer has a meeting place because Gracie forgot to pay the rent on their clubhouse. She invites the ladies to have their meetings in the Burns' living room instead.

title: The Football Game
description: The Burns and Mortons each buy four tickets for the football game, but when they realize there are more tickets than people, each couple decides to sell them - and matters worse, Gracie tries to unload hers on a cop.

title: Surprise Birthday Party
description: Gracie plans a surprise birthday party for George. The plan is that he is to invite all his friends to the Mocambo nightclub for a party but they are to decline his invitation, leaving him to think that nobody has remembered his birthday. However, Gracie being Gracie, things go awry quickly.

title: Thanksgiving
description: Gracie is having friends over for Thanksgiving dinner, including Harry Morton's business partner and his wife, Linda Lee. As it happens, a horse that Harry is betting on is also named Linda Lee, and Grace gets the two "Linda Lees" confused. Complications ensue.

title: New Dresses for the Concert
description: The Uplifters society is having a concert and Gracie and Blanche want new dresses.

title: Christmas with Mamie Kelly
description: Mamie is back with the girls to visit for the holidays.

title: Gracie's Storeroom
description: Gracie has a storeroom built so she can store canned fruits and vegetables. When the project gets out of hand, George hires someone to pretend he's a building inspector to tell her she doesn't have a permit and will have to tear the storeroom down.

title: Blanche for President
description: Blanche enters the race for the presidency of the Beverly Hills Uplifters.

title: Dinner With the Vanderlips
description: George and Harry have some trouble when the Vanderlips are invited over to the Burns home for dinner.

title: Gracie and the Dented Fender
description: Gracie accidentally dents the fender on the family car, and decides to get it fixed without telling George about it.

title: Trip to Palm Springs
description: When George and Gracie take a trip to Jack Benny's Palm Springs home, Gracie has Blanche fake an illness so Harry Morton will let her tag along. Meanwhile, Harry Von Zell tries to worm out of his contract so he can accept a movie role.

title: Gracie's Engagement Ring
description: George finds Gracie's lost engagement ring and decides to keep it to teach her a lesson - but he loses it to a pickpocket. Meanwhile, Harry Von Zell devises a sneaky plan to prevent George from shaving time off his commercial.

title: Harry and the Gold Digger
description: To help Jane out of a tricky situation, Gracie sets up Harry von Zell with gold-digging Flossie Hardwick. Meanwhile, a pie promoter tries to sell George on a new gimmick to improve the show.

title: The Good Old Days of Vaudeville
description: George and Gracie recall the good old days of vaudeville to a producer who's making a documentary on the subject.

title: Jack Benny Steals George's Joke
description: Jack steals a joke from George when they're playing a benefit in San Francisco and as a result they feud.

title: Gracie's Redecoration Scheme
description: Gracie wants to redecorate, and to get George out of the house she tricks him into taking Harry Morton fishing. However, when Harry declines to go fishing, Grace has to come up with another plan to get rid of George.

title: The Speech Writer
description: Mamie Kelly and her obnoxious kids again park their trailer in George and Gracie's driveway and cause lots of trouble as they obstruct George's endeavor to write a speech.

title: Divorce Attorney
description: Gracie consults with a divorce attorney after a swami reads her palm and tells her that one day she'll have a second husband.

title: The Musical Scam
description: Harry von Zell and George get conned into investing money in a musical which George is promised the lead role in.

title: Dual Meanings
description: When George announces he's getting a new "secretary," Gracie mistakes the desk for a person and hires a detective to uncover the identity of this woman. The investigator mistakes Harry Morton for George, further escalating confusion.

title: The Great Gazatti
description: Gracie tells a record company exec she's married to a famous singer and promises to bring him in. In Gracie's mind, George IS a famous singer.

title: The $50,000 Lie
description: The Mortons invite George and Gracie to the Happy Time Lodge, but George doesn't want to go so he comes up with a story that he has to come up with $50,000 that night and he won't be able to go if he doesn't get the money. Gracie overhears this and, thinking that she and George are broke, plans to rent out their spare rooms to boarders.

title: The Stolen Racehorse
description: Gracie goes to the racetrack and winds up buying a horse. The horse's former owners accompany Gracie back to the house and wind up moving in. Meanwhile, the police have been looking for the horse because the animal's "owners" are actually horse thieves--and they track it to George's house.

title: The Spectacular Spectacle Debacle
description: George tells Gracie that he ran into George Jessel at the Friars Club, but Gracie somehow misinterprets it into thinking that George thinks he needs glasses. She gets an eye doctor to come to the house to give George an exam, but it turns out that the doctor needs glasses more than anyone else does.

title: Gracie and Blanche Want to Redecorate
description: Gracie and Blanche want to redecorate their houses, but they know that George and Harry won't go for it. Gracie comes up with a plan to get George out of the house--she invites her relatives to stay for two weeks.

title: Wardrobe Woman Wins Free Trip to Hawaii
description: Gracie tries to play cupid for Harry and her wardrobe woman, not realizing that the woman is married already and has two children

title: Gracie Giving Party for Atomic Scientist
description: Gracie gives a dinner party for a famous but somewhat eccentric atomic scientist, who never accepts invitations. However, the scientist hears that George was in Las Vegas at the time of the atomic testing and, thinking that George is a fellow scientist, accepts Gracie's invitation.

title: George Sneezing/Gracie Thinks He's Insane
description: George has been sneezing for a comedy routine, so Gracie takes a medical exam for him and the doctor concludes she's mentally ill. Meanwhile, a dieting Harry Morton hides food all over the house.

title: Gracie Buying Boat for George
description: Harry Morton and Harry Von Zell try to persuade George that he's overworked and needs to buy a boat so he can go sailing on the ocean and relax. Their main reason, however, is that THEY want to go sailing and figure they can trick George into buying the boat. In order to do that, they concoct a scheme to make him think he's going crazy under the "pressures" of work by making him think he's someone named "Charlie Cochran".

title: Gracie Having George's Portrait Painted
description: Gracie hires an artist to paint a portrait of George. But the painter is confounded when Gracie explains that she wants to give the portrait to George as a surprise gift.

title: Gracie and Blanche Hire Two Gigolos to Take Them Out
description: Blanche and Gracie want to have a night out on the town with their husbands, but the boys aren't having any part of it. Frustrated after the men continually ignore pointed hints, the wives decide to hire a pair of male "escorts" to take them out, thinking that might finally wake up their husbands. Complications ensue.

title: Sampter Clayton Ballet/Selling Tickets
description: Gracie's interest in sponsoring the ballet leads to her friends selling tickets and to jobs for two dancers who pose as the family's maid and butler.

title: Skating Pearsons Come to Visit
description: A couple from George and Gracie's vaudeville days, "The Skating Pearsons" drop by for a visit. They're worried that their son, Joey, wants to get into show business, and ask George and Gracie to talk the boy out of it.

title: Gracie Selling Swamp So Harry Will Buy TV Set
description: To get Harry to buy Blanche a TV, Gracie tries to get him to buy some swampland--but Harry gets the idea that there's oil under the property.

title: Silky Thompson/Gracie Writes 'My Life with George Burns'
description: Gracie fabricates a magazine article claiming George once beat up an infamous gangster who shows up at the Burns home in a very bad mood.

title: Gracie Thinks George Is Going to Commit Suicide
description: Gracie discovers a note in George's pocket, which she misinterprets to be a suicide note.

title: Von Zell Dates Married Woman/Jealous Husband
description: Gracie interferes after Harry Von Zell goes out with a married woman and the result is a mistaken-identity lawsuit against Harry Morton.

title: Uncle Clyde Comes to Visit/Renting Room
description: George scrambles to rent the spare room before Gracie's uncle arrives for a visit, but everyone's plans incur some hiccups.

title: Gracie Thinks Harry Morton Is in Love With Her
description: Harry buys an anniversary present for Blanche and hides it at the Burns' home. However, Gracie finds it and thinks that Harry has fallen in love with her and is trying to win her from George. She sets out to come up with a scheme to "discourage" Harry and show him that he and Gracie are not meant for each other.

title: Gracie Trying to Keep Mortons From Moving Away
description: Harry Morton trades his house for one across town. Gracie doesn't want to lose her best friend Blanche, so when the new neighbors move into the Mortons' house, Gracie does everything she can think of to convince them that they wouldn't want to live next door to a household as crazy as the Burns' one.

title: Gracie Thinks She's Not Married to George
description: George has to convince Gracie that they are legally married, but convincing Gracie of anything is never easy.

title: Tax Refund
description: Graice invites the mayor of Los Angeles for dinner.

roles.char: Fletcher Bowron, Mayor of Los Angeles

title: Cigarette Girl/Georgie Jessel/Teddy Bear
description: A vague gossip column tip and a mysterious teddy bear lead Gracie to believe George is two-timing her with a cigarette girl. Meanwhile Harry Morton's lies about his late-night poker game cause Blanche to question his actual whereabouts.

title: Gracie on Train/Murder
description: After a man on a train jokingly tells her that he plans to murder his wife, Gracie's confusing explanations land George and Harry Morton in the slammer.

title: Blanche Wants New Car/Gracie Gets Von Zell a Wife
description: Gracie tries to find Von Zell a wife and children so he can save money on his income tax.

title: Gracie Gives a Swamp Party
description: Gracie has a very "entertaining" way of helping Harry Morton in his real estate business.

title: George and Gracie Hear a Burglar/Up All Night
description: When Harry Morton makes noise while coming downstairs to turn of his car's headlights one night, George thinks it's a prowler breaking in and goes to investigate. Then Blanche Morton hears George stumbling around and thinks HE'S a burglar. The police are called and wind up arresting Harry Von Zell!

title: Gracie Buying a Ranch for George
description: Gracie gets the idea that George is looking to buy a ranch, so she starts looking for one for sale. George, who actually doesn't want to move to a ranch, gets Harry Von Zell to pretend he's a doctor and tell Gracie that George's "condition" precludes his living on a ranch. However, real-estate agent Harry Morton has a client with a ranch for sale, and gets his partner Casey to pretend he's a doctor and tell Gracie that George actually should move to a ranch.

title: Gracie Gets George in the Army
description: Gracie is worried about the fact that George hasn't been sleeping well, so she decides that what he needs is a stint in the Army Reserve. An army doctor who was to give George his entrance physical exam mistakenly examines Harry Morton, who goes along with it because he thinks the doctor is there to examine him for an insurance policy. Before he knows it, Harry finds himself in the army.

title: Gracie Reports Car Stolen
description: Someone whistles in George's dressing room and Gracie, believing the old show-biz superstition that it will mean three days of bad luck, hides George's car so that he can't make a scheduled trip to Palm Springs. George reports the car stolen, but eventually gets it back and sets off on his drive to Palm Springs--where he's arrested by the police because his car is still on the "hot car" list.

title: Gracie Pretends to Be a College Boy's Mother
description: A young college student wants to impress his girlfriend by asking George and Gracie to pose as his parents. Gracie goes along with it but George refuses. Gracie talks Harry Von Zell into playing the role but, unknown to her, Blanche Morton talks her husband Harry into playing George. Unfortunately, both Harrys show up Gracie's house at the same time as the student and his girlfriend.

title: Misunderstanding Over Buying Mountain Cabin
description: Harry Von Zell is planning to buy a mountain cabin, and gives Gracie as a reference. The real estate agent Harry's using calls Gracie, who comes to the conclusion that George is the one buying a cabin. When she mentions this to Harry Morton, who's a real estate agent, he gets upset that George is buying from another agent. Complications ensue.

title: Blanche Secretly Buys a Fur Stole
description: There's great confusion as to whether it was Blanche or Gracie who secretly bought a mink stole; and then the whereabouts of the fur come into question, prompting Gracie to involve the police.

title: Gracie Takes Spanish Lessons
description: Gracie's attempt to straighten out her Spanish teacher's work visa puts George in jeopardy of being deported to Spain.

title: Gracie & Cleaning Woman/Vanderlips
description: Gracie jeopardizes Harry Morton's bank loan and George and Harry Von Zell's well-being when she mistakenly determines Mr. Vanderlip has been having an affair with his cook.

title: Von Zell's Girlfriend Between Trains
description: Harry Von Zell attempts to impress his ex-girlfriend by passing off Gracie as his wife. Meanwhile, Blanche worries that her husband is being bullied by his business partner, and George tries to straighten out Gracie's checking account.

title: George Lectures at UCLA
description: George receives an invitation to speak at a UCLA forum on television, but he loses his nerve after hearing his friends mocking him.

title: Gracie and Harry Morton/Missing Persons Bureau
description: Gracie causes needless headaches for Blanche, the police and an insurance agent when she reports Harry Morton missing.

title: Surprise Party for Mortons/Sanitarium Routine
description: Harry Morton's friends plan a surprise party for his birthday, but Gracie mistakenly thinks the party is for George and she accidentally has Harry committed to a sanitarium.

title: Perry & Pete/Gracie's Cousins/Sneak Thieves
description: George invites a pair of burglars to stay in their home after Gracie introduces them as her cousins.

title: Gracie Doing a Picture Without George
description: Some amusement results when Gracie finds a telegram from 1923. In it, George is asked to do a Broadway show, but without his partner. Gracie does not notice the date on the telegram, and tries to figure out a way to make George feel free to do the show without her.

title: Gracie Trying to Get George to Go on Trip East
description: When Gracie learns the Mortons are going on a road trip with another couple, she tries to coax George into going.

title: Gracie Sees a Hold-Up/Johnny Velvet
description: Gracie is scheduled to testify about witnessing a bank robbery, which sets off a string of botched kidnappings. Meanwhile, George is elated about crooning some tunes at a party in Ronald Reagan's honor, but no one wants to hear him sing.

title: Gracie and George Locked Out of Their House
description: Thanks to Gracie's carelessness, the Burns and Mortons get locked out of their homes in the middle of the night, much to the chagrin of the locksmith's jealous wife.

title: Gracie at Department Store
description: Gracie trips and falls, as a result of her high heel getting caught in a hole in the rug at the department store. The store's management attempts to reach a monetary settlement with Gracie, but are thwarted by confused resistance.

title: Morton Buys Iron Deer/Gracie Thinks George Needs Glasses
description: When George declares he "can't see" how Harry Morton could spend $200 on an iron deer for his lawn, Gracie concludes George's eyesight is deteriorating.

title: Gracie Helps Morton Get CPA Account
description: Gracie interferes with Harry Morton's promotion by pretending to divorce him. Meanwhile, a chicken which Gracie plans to cook for dinner gets drunk and runs amok in the neighborhood.

title: Gracie Gets a Jury Summons
description: Gracie receives a juror notice, and everyone thinks she should get out of it, except for Gracie.

title: George Teaches Gracie Not to Be Careless
description: Gracie mistakenly gets the notion that Blanche is kleptomaniac and wreaks havoc trying to cover up for her.

title: George and Harry Mad at Each Other
description: A mutual acquaintance ticks off George and Harry Morton, so Gracie thinks they're mad at each other. To patch up their friendship, Gracie decides to turn them both against Harry Von Zell.

title: Gracie Gets a Business Manager
description: Gracie mistakes the Mortons' lawn man for the business manager she hired.

title: Raccoon Coat Story
description: After Gracie gives away Harry Morton's fur coat, she goes to great lengths to procure a replacement.

title: Gracie Thinks Harry is Broke
description: Gracie has the mistaken impression that Harry Von Zell is broke, and, of course, endeavors to help him.

title: Gracie Going to San Francisco
description: Gracie and Blanche are planning to visit Gracie's mom, and their husband's are happy to be getting some free time of their own, while they're away.

title: Gracie Thinks George is Retiring from Show Business
description: The Burns house is put in jeopardy when a misheard telephone conversation between George and Jack Benny gives Gracie the impression that George is quitting show business.

title: George and Gracie Going to Rose Marie Premiere
description: Gracie and George get a limited amount of tickets to a movie premiere, and pledge them to too many friends.

title: Problem Husbands
description: In a bizarre attempt to help Jane straighten out her marital woes, Gracie decides to find a job where she can earn more money than George does.

title: Gracie's Anniversary Present
description: Gracie is under the mistaken impression that George is going to surprise her with an airplane for their wedding anniversary.

title: Uncle Harvey's Invention
description: George unknowingly makes Gracie think her uncle's plant food works miraculously well.

title: George Reading Play to Be Done in London
Gracie Helps Mechanic with Girlfriend
description: Gracie tries to dissuade the mechanic's girlfriend from swooning over celebrities by fabricating stories of George's cruelty and abuse, but she blabs to the wrong woman and the tall-tales become front-page headlines.

title: Gracie Discovers George's Secret Weakness
description: Gracie reads an article which claims one in five men has a secret vice and concludes George is the one. Meanwhile, Mr. Vanderlip tries to straighten out Gracie's bank account, and George and the two Harrys try to sneak off to the fights.

title: Gracie Has to Sell George's Car by Five O'Clock
description: When the fire inspector orders Gracie to remove a trash pile which is stacked next to the garage, she thinks he means for her to get rid of the car. With her frantic attempt to unload the automobile by 5 p.m., everyone suspects it's stolen.

title: Gracie Wins a Television Set
description: Gracie becomes convinced that she won a TV set on a quiz show. Meanwhile, word gets back to Harry Morton that George and Harry Von Zell called him a square.

title: No Fan Mail for George
description: George is unhappy about not receiving any fan mail, so Gracie instructs Blanche to write a phony fan letter. Unfortunately this correspondence upsets both Harry Morton and the jealous husband of the woman whose name Blanche signed.

title: George and Gracie Going to Opera 'Carmen'
description: Everyone is elated when Mr. Vanderlip invites them to the opera except for George, who's adamant about seeing a 3-D movie instead.

title: Harry Morton Is Missing
description: When Harry Morton goes missing, Gracie hires a private investigator who becomes very confused about the identity of his new client and her associates.

title: Gracie Goes to Psychiatrist for Blanche's Dream
description: Gracie visits a bewildered psychiatrist for dream analysis, which unexpectedly results in Blanche and Harry Morton each believing the other is crazy.

title: Gracie's Old Boy Friend, Dan Conroy, Comes to Town
description: When Gracie's athletic ex comes to visit, she swipes Harry Morton's trophies to pass off as her husband's. Further complications ensue when the awards go missing.

title: The Old Grads
description: Gracie decides to enroll George in college. Meanwhile, George's production manager frantically searches for someone who can get Gracie out of a traffic ticket.

title: Columbia Pictures Doing Burns and Allen Story
description: Columbia is doing the Burns and Allen story and everybody wants to get into the act.

title: An Elephant Sits on Gracie's Fender
description: Although it's true, Gracie has difficulty convincing everyone that a circus elephant really smashed her car.

title: George Gets Black Eye from Open Door
description: George's black eye and another man's broken leg lead people to believe the two men were brawling. Meanwhile, Gracie attempts to outsmart an insurance investigator, and Harry Von Zell tries to book a contortionist on the show.

title: Dolores De Marco, George's Ex-Vaudeville Partner
description: To avoid a lawsuit, George dodges a man who spends the day patiently waiting on the front porch. Meanwhile, jealousy and mistaken-identity drive Gracie to extremes when the young daughter of George's ex-girlfriend visits.

title: Vanderlip Buys Black Negligee for His Wife
description: Relationships are jeopardized after a meddling Gracie listens in on a phone call and concludes that Mr. Vanderlip is having an affair with a saleswoman.

roles.char: The Man in the Dentist's Office

title: Gracie and George Have a Mystery Anniversary
description: Gracie throws an extravagant 9th "Hmm-Hmm" anniversary party, having forgotten the event that she's celebrating. A cook and butler hired for the occasion are bemused by Gracie's eccentricities.

title: George Resting for Insurance Examination
description: George tries to get a full day's rest before his doctor's exam, but he soon finds friends, family, a telephone repairman, roofer and electrician tromping across his bed.

roles.char: Woman Who Wants to Use Payphone
Mr. Adams the TV Aerial Repairman

title: One Week to Live
description: George and Gracie believe that Harry Morton has only one week to live. Blanche and Harry Morton believe that George has only one week to live. Harry von Zell initiated this confusion but he's completely clueless.

title: Gracie Buys Old Movies to Sell to Television
description: George passes on an offer to buy the rights to some old films, but Gracie decides the deal would be in his best interest after consulting a psychic.

title: Emily Vanderlip's Elopement
description: Although Emily Vanderlip has no desire to elope, Gracie pushes the matter until everyone's upset and Harry Von Zell is in police custody.

title: Gracie Runs for City Council
description: When a councilwoman asks for Gracie's support, she mistakenly thinks she's being asked to run for city council herself.

title: Burnses and Mortons Choosing Movie to Attend
description: The Burns and Mortons decide to go to the movies but have difficulty finding a film that none of them have seen. Further complicating matters, Al and Harry Von Zell arrive and decide to tag along.

roles.char: The Man at the Writing Desk
Man with Parcels in Postal Line

title: Gracie Buys a Toaster Wholesale
description: When Gracie realizes how much money she can save by buying wholesale, she orders a full kitchens-worth of appliances for herself and Blanche.

title: Mortons Exchange Houses with the Gibsons from New York
description: Harry and Blanche's friends from New York precipitate a housing crisis when they come to stay in the Morton house.

title: George Teaches Gracie Not to Start Rumors
description: George gives Gracie an example of how a rumor can begin and Gracie inadvertently spreads the rumor, which builds until everyone believes George was a big winner in Las Vegas.

title: George Invites Critics to Watch First Show of Season
description: George invites two newspaper reporters, while Gracie secretly invites two dozen strangers over to the house to view their opening night show.

roles.char: The Woman at the Book Counter

title: Gracie Goes to the 'Do It Yourself' Show
description: Gracie hires a carpenter to build a dresser. She then tries to fool her neighbors into thinking George built it by himself.

title: Gracie Gives Wedding in Payment of a Favor
description: Gracie throws an extravagant wedding, but George can't figure out why his wife has taken on this responsibility.

roles.char: Wedding Guest having a Good Time

title: Gracie Gives a Baby Shower for Virginia Beasley
description: When Gracie throws a baby shower for the mailman's daughter, George gets stuck playing cards with Harry Morton's stuffy friends.

title: Auto License Bureau/George Becomes an Author
description: Gracie tests the patience of a driver's license examiner. Meanwhile, George's friends lavish him with praise and gifts after learning he's writing an autobiography.

title: George Trying to Keep Doctor's Appointment
description: George has an appointment to take a physical exam, but each time he's prepared to leave a distraction pulls him away from his car and Gracie absconds with his keys.

title: Gracie Thinks She and George Are Moving to New York
description: When Gracie fears that they might have to move to New York for business reasons, she consults Mr. Beasley the postman, and concocts a crazy story about George witnessing a robbery.

roles.char: The Man with the Comic Book

title: Shoplifter and the Missing Ruby Clip
description: Trouble arises when Gracie gets the impression that Mrs. Vanderlip has stolen a ruby clip from a department store and tries to help her avoid apprehension.

title: Gracie Saves Blanche's Marriage
description: After reading Blanche's fortune, Gracie concludes Blanche is in love with a man she encountered at the grocery store. Gracie attempts to intervene, dragging Harry Von Zell's name through the mud in the process.

title: Burnses & Mortons Going to Hear Antonelli Concert
description: George thinks he's come up with the perfect plan to get out of attending a concert. He gives Gracie a jigsaw puzzle and hopes she'll be too distracted to remember the concert's starting time.

title: George Gets Call from Unknown Victor
description: George gets irritated when Gracie mishandles a telephone call. She remembers the message, but not the caller's last name or phone number.

title: Harry Morton's Alumni Banquet
description: Harry Morton tries to get Gracie to ask George to emcee a banquet, but she gets confused and thinks she herself is being asked to be master of ceremonies. She pawns the job off on Harry Von Zell, who incurs George's wrath.

title: Gracie Thinks Bob Cummings Is in Love with Her
description: Gracie overhears Bob Cummings reciting dialogue for his TV show and concludes that she is the object of his affections.

title: George's Mother-in-Law Trouble
description: George decides to invite his mother-in-law for a brief stay, but a misheard conversation at the post office leads Harry Von Zell to spread word that the forthcoming visit has caused an enormous fight between George and Gracie.

roles.char: The Man with the Money Order

title: George and the Glendale Eagle Publicity Stunt
description: Thanks to Gracie, George is scheduled to take part in a publicity stunt. To get out of it, George claims to have a sprained ankle.

title: No Seats for Friar's Club Dinner
description: The Friar's Club testimonial dinner for George and Gracie is sold out, but Gracie is intent on figuring out a way to get the Mortons and the Bagleys in.

title: Blanche and Clara Bagley Leave Their Husbands
description: Gracie offers the Burns' guest room to two friends who are feuding with their husbands.

title: Gracie Gets a Valet for George
description: Against her husband's wishes, Gracie hires a valet to help George with everyday tasks such as getting dressed.

title: Vanderlip Leaves His Parakeet with George
description: Mr. Vanderlip entrusts his beloved parakeet with George while he's out of town but Gracie assumes it's her anniversary present and, feeling sorry for the caged bird, decides to set it free.

title: Blanche's Brother, Roger the Moocher, Visits
description: Blanche's freeloading brother comes to stay with the Mortons. Nothing is safe around him, including Harry Morton's clothes, George's cigars, and Harry von Zell's girlfriend.

title: George and the Missing Five Dollars and Missing Baby Pictures
description: George's apparently compulsive behavior as he appears to be searching for a lost five dollar bill leads to trouble, as Gracie, the Mortons, and Von Zell all try to help him regain his sanity.

title: Gracie Becomes a Portrait Artist After Museum Visit
description: Gracie wants to help George learn about art, so she visits a museum and gains enough knowledge to get mixed up about the subject.

title: George and the 14-Karat Gold Trombone
description: A trombone entrusted to George causes a lot of trouble for the two Harrys.

title: The Romance of Harry Morton and Countess Braganni
description: When Countess Braganni moves in next door, Blanche becomes convinced that her husband is vying for the countess's affections.

title: The Mistaken Marriage of Emily Vanderlip and Roger
description: Gracie mistakenly concludes that Blanche's devious brother Roger is going to marry Emily Vanderlip, so Roger uses the ensuing confusion to try to extort money from George.

title: Gracie Adopts Great Dane Dog
description: Gracie tries to help Joey Bagley by concealing his dog; meanwhile, George is under the mistaken impression that Gracie's Uncle Harvey is visiting.

title: Gracie Tries to Select George's Next Wife
description: Gracie is under the wrong impression that she is ill and will soon die, so she auditions potential future wives for George.

title: Gracie Gets a Ticket 'Fixed' by the Judge
description: Gracie's parking ticket leads to trouble with the law for George, Von Zell, and the Mortons.

title: Gracie Hires a Safecracker for Her Wall Safe
description: Gracie tries to surprise George by having a wall safe installed, but she promptly locks the combination inside along with papers that he urgently needs access to. To rectify the situation, Gracie visits a pool hall to hire a safecracker.

title: Gracie Consults Dr. Kirby's Problem Clinic
description: After a friend confides that her presumed-dead first husband is still alive, Gracie visits a TV therapist to try to find a solution to the predicament.

title: Gracie Wants the House Painted
description: Gracie would like to have the house painted coral, but George wants it to stay white. Once again, Von Zell and the Mortons get involved in a confusing situation, along with some befuddled house painters.

title: Gracie Plays Talent Scout for Imitator
description: An impressionist impersonates the grocery delivery boy and wows Gracie and her friends, but when George contacts the real delivery boy to offer him a job on the show, he's baffled by the kid's lack of talent.

title: Gracie & George Try for a Day at the Beach
description: George has an important business meeting at the beach, but Gracie thinks it's a pleasure trip and invites their friends to tag along. Unfortunately, each time they're prepared to leave, some interruption detains them.

title: The Uranium Caper
description: An unsuccessful uranium prospecting expedition by the two Harrys sets the stage for a showdown between them and George over partnerships in non-existent mines.

title: Blanche and Brother Roger Move in with the Burnses
description: When Blanche's brother shows up unexpectedly, it causes such a rift between Blanche and Harry that she decides to leave him. Blanche and Roger take up residence at the Burns' home, so George rooms with Harry, fearing his own divorce.

title: Gracie Believes George Has a Criminal Record
description: Danny Goodman, an old vaudeville partner of George's, comes to visit. Trouble starts when they decide to dress in prison outfits and reprise their "jailbird" song and dance routine.

title: Gracie Gets an Extension Visa for Jeanette Duval
description: Gracie befriends a lovely young French woman with immigration problems and decides to marry her off to Harry Von Zell to keep her in the country.

title: Gracie Tries to Cure Roger of Amnesia
description: Harry Morton arranges a job for Roger out of state, so Roger fakes amnesia - but he lets George in on the scam, knowing no one else would believe it's a ruse. To find a cure, Gracie goes to a doctor and claims she's the one with amnesia.

title: Lucille Vanderlip Gives a Barbeque Party
description: Lucille Vanderlip is planning a barbeque party, but George is convinced that Gracie is really throwing a party at home.

title: The Burnses and Mortons Going to Hawaii
description: Harry Morton and George thwart their wives' plans for a Hawaiian vacation until Blanche's brother unexpectedly arrives - and then they can't wait to get away.

title: The Burnses and Mortons Go to New York
description: While on a train to New York, Gracie confuses a salesman with a famous nuclear scientist. Gracie also plays cards with the scientist -- and wins every time.

title: Ronnie Arrives
description: Ronnie Burns arrives in New York, determined to shun comedy for dramatic acting.

title: Ronnie Meets Sabrina
description: A beautiful young gold digger woos Harry Von Zell and then sets her sights on Ronnie, who perceives a date with this slightly "older woman" as the exact life experience that he needs to effectively portray a character in his latest play.

title: Changing Names
description: As part of his plan to become a dramatic actor, Ronnie changes his name to Cobb Cochran, so Gracie changes her name to Lola Benedict, but a misunderstood phone call leads everyone to believe George is cheating on Gracie with Lola.

title: Harry Morton's Cocktail Party
description: While visiting the book store to push George's autobiography, Blanche wallops a man whom she mistakes for a masher, not knowing he's the same guy that Harry has made business-dinner plans with. Meanwhile, Ronnie decides to get a motorcycle.

title: The Musical Version
description: There are plans for George's autobiography to be adapted as a stage musical, and everyone is eager to invest - not knowing that George wants to star as himself. Meanwhile, Ronnie and Velma endlessly rehearse their own play.

title: Ronnie Moves to the Village
description: Gracie plots to disrupt Ronnie's plans to move to Greenwich Village with his actor friend, Jim Boardman.

title: Gracie Helps Lola
description: Lola is down in the dumps because her boyfriend won't propose marriage. Gracie comes up with a plan to make it happen.

title: Anniversary Party
description: It's George's and Gracie's anniversary, and a party is planned. However, Mr. Boardman and his wife start having an argument, and in Gracie's effort to "fix" it, she winds up "unfixing" everyone else.

title: George Becomes a Dictator
description: Everyone gets involved in Ronnie's acting dilemma: he must choose between a comedic and a dramatic role.

title: Ronnie's Elopement
description: Marie, the hotel's new cigarette girl, attracts the attention of all the men in the building. When she gives Gracie a vague message about Ronnie's tickets for a trip to Connecticut, Gracie assumes her son is planning to elope with her.

title: Company for Christmas
description: For Christmas, Harry Morton invites his father and Blanche invites her brother. Unfortunately the hotel is booked solid - so Gracie attempts to create a vacancy. Meanwhile, Ronnie invites Jim so they can work on scripting a new play.

title: Gracie Pawns Her Ring
description: George refuses to fund Jim Boardman's play, so Gracie raises the money by pawning the diamond ring he gave to her for Christmas.

title: Appearances Are Deceiving
description: Mary Brewster's puritanical father arrives, finds her rehearsing a love scene with Ronnie and mistakes it for the real thing, so Gracie concocts a scheme to catch him in a compromising situation too.

title: Let's Dance
description: Gracie takes out an expensive ad in Ronnie's charity dance program without telling George, and then she uses Marie as bait to boost ticket sales.

title: George Goes Skiing
description: After Mr. Boardman takes Jim and Ronnie skiing, Gracie tells George that he needs to take more of an interest in Ronnie's life, so George hits the slopes.

title: Ronnie Gets an Agent
description: A fight erupts between George and his son when an unscrupulous talent agent with ulterior motives offers Ronnie a contract. Meanwhile, Ronnie dreads embarrassment when his latest girlfriend's high society parents come to dinner.

title: Politeness Never Pays
description: Gracie and Blanche want their husbands to be gallant, as they were during their courtship.

title: Alice Gets Married
description: When Alice, Harry von Zell's old girlfriend, comes to see him in New York, he believes that she plans to propose marriage. Gracie manages to complicate matters by spreading a rumor that he secretly wed Marie, the cigarette girl.

title: George Needs Glasses
description: Gracie catches George in a lie and concludes his vision is deteriorating. When he refuses to visit the eye doctor, she presumes he's afraid glasses will hinder his appearance, so she insists that all of their friends to sport spectacles.

title: The Indian Potentate
description: An Indian Maharajah and his "retinue" have checked into the St. Moritz Hotel, and Gracie and Blanche cannot contain their curiosity, so they attempt to sneak onto his private floor. Meanwhile, Ronnie goes out with the Maharajah's daughter.

title: The Ladies' Club
description: Harry Morton is so terrified that his career will be ruined if Gracie joins an elite women's club that Blanche makes a fool of herself. Meanwhile, Ronnie and his parents baffle everyone when they practice the Stanislavski acting method.

title: Cyrano De Bergerac
description: Ronnie lands the lead in a production of Cyrano de Bergerac but worries that he lacks the talent to play the part, so his parents go to great lengths to boost his confidence. Meanwhile, Blanche's niece arrives for a visit.

title: The Stolen Plants
description: After Gracie walks off with some plants from Central Park, Harry Morton declares she has committed a crime, so she decides to turn herself in. Meanwhile, Ronnie takes up fencing for his latest stage outing.

title: The English Playwright
description: Gracie tracks down playwright Raymond Curtis to get Ronnie a role, and during their conversation she claims to be a widow. George gleefully complicates matters when Mr. Curtis asks Gracie to his apartment for a romantic dinner.

title: A Weekend on Long Island
description: When Ronnie makes plans to hold a party for his class in the family's suite, Gracie decides to accept Blanche's invitation to Mrs. Sohmers' party at Oyster Bay. The problem is that neither Blanche nor Mrs. Sohmers invited her.

title: The Newlyweds
description: When Emily Vanderlip arrives in Manhattan after eloping with Airman Second Class Frank Foster, the newlyweds and Burns men attempt to keep Gracie from finding out about their nuptials, fearing that she'll blab to Emily's parents.

title: Night of Vaudeville
description: Ronnie's drama school is losing money and decides to put on its usual production of "Othello" to raise funds. However, Gracie talks them into doing a variety show instead, the type of vaudeville skits that she and George used to do.

title: Burlesk
description: Everyone praises George for his performance at Ronnie's school the previous evening, but when he graciously accepts their compliments he's accused of having an inflated ego. Meanwhile, Jim and Ronnie try out for jobs in a burlesque theater.

title: The Right People
description: When Ronnie takes out Pat Sohmers, Gracie concludes that they're planning to wed, but this news doesn't sit well with status-conscious Mrs. Sohmers - or Pat, who's contemplating marrying another man.

title: The Magic Act
description: When Ronnie is offered a movie contract, Gracie misunderstands a phone call and thinks that George is taking on a side-job without her, so she takes a job as a magician's assistant.

title: A Paris Creation
description: After insisting that Gracie take her defective new dress to its designer for repair, George finds himself on a flight to Paris, France.

title: Back from Paris
description: Ronnie's in love with Yvette; Harry von Zell's in love with the stewardess; and Gracie's in love with the two dozen dresses that she's flying with back to New York.

title: The Twenty-Four Dresses
description: Gracie plans to open a dress shop with the wardrobe she bought in Paris, but George insists on sending the dresses back, so she enlists Harry Von Zell and Ronnie to intercept the inventory and Mrs. Sohmers to finance the store.

title: Ronnie Is Lovesick
description: When Ronnie locks himself in his room to rehearse a role, Gracie thinks he's heartbroken because Yvette has gone back to Paris, so she hires a beautiful model to pose as George's new secretary in hopes that Ronnie will fall for her.

title: The Night Out
description: George falls asleep on the massage table at the Friar's Club and gets locked in for the night. When the hat-check girl from The Stork Club later drops off his coat, which Harry Von Zell borrowed for a date, Gracie seeks a divorce.

title: Questions and Answers
description: Blanche threatens to resign from The Ladies of Oyster Bay if Gracie isn't permitted membership, but first she must pass a literary quiz, so Mrs. Sohmers decides to help Gracie cheat. Meanwhile, Harry Von Zell offers to teach Ronnie judo.

title: The Triple Surprise Party
description: To prevent Gracie from ruining Harry Morton's birthday party, George tells her he's throwing a party for Ronnie. To ensure he shows up, Gracie tells Ronnie the party's for George. Meanwhile, Harry Von Zell presumes he's the guest of honor.

title: Mrs. Sohmers Needs a Psychologist
description: Mrs. Sohmers is finding it difficult to live in a world containing a Gracie Allen, so she consults a psychologist who believes Gracie is a figment of her imagination. Meanwhile, Von Zell tries to shock Gracie by pouring water in his pocket.

title: The Switchboard Operator
description: When Harry Morton is offered a new position which would require him to stay on the road for two years, Blanche and Gracie hijack the hotel's telephone switchboard to prevent him from placing a call to accept the job.

title: Return to California
description: The Burnses, Mortons, and Harry von Zell unexpectedly return home to California, only to be surprised by Ronnie and the twenty co-eds, who he's allowed to take up residence in their homes without their prior knowledge or approval.

title: The Shakespeare Paper
description: Gracie decides to help Ronnie get ahead at school, so she rewrites his essay on one of Shakespeare's plays. Meanwhile, Harry Von Zell begs George to get him an audition with producer William Goetz.

title: The Woman in the Car
description: When Gracie borrows the Mortons' car, she leaves behind a parking ticket upon which the officer has scribbled an unusual note. Blanche finds the citation and concludes Harry's been having an affair with a "very cooperative" woman.

title: The Interview
description: The Burns' are interviewed by a reporter who hopes to talk to the real people, not their wacky TV personas. Meanwhile, Ronnie joins the school cheerleading squad; Mrs. Sohmers hopes to meet her matine idol; and Von Zell gets a stuntman.

title: Ronnie's Initiation
description: As part of his college fraternity initiation, Ronnie must say and do the opposite of what people would normally expect. Meanwhile, Mrs. Sohmers decides to reside in Pasadena, but Gracie gets mixed up and thinks the Mortons are moving.

title: Ronnie's Bashful
description: Harry Von Zell makes plans to treat the Burns and Mortons to a night on the town. Meanwhile, Gracie learns Ronnie's skipping a school dance and jumps to the conclusion that her son is bashful, so she endeavors to set up a date for him.

title: The Missing Stamp
description: Harry Morton suspects his no-good brother-in-law, Roger, of swiping his hundred-dollar Madagascar Imperial stamp from his cherished collection. Little does he know, Gracie has stuck it on an envelope she intends to mail.

title: George's Gray Suit
description: Gracie ships George's new gray suit to Roger, but when George gets wind of it, he intercepts the package. Meanwhile, Gracie concocts a phony story about a burglary and gets everyone involved - even the police.

roles.char: The Man at the Post Office

title: Von Zell's Raises
description: Gracie wants to find chaperones for Ronnie's ski trip, so she decides Harry Von Zell should marry Vivian so they can accompany the kids. George gives Harry a series of raises to accommodate the new groom and garner some laughs for himself.

title: The Refrigerator Salesman
description: Ronnie lands a job at as an electric-razor salesman in a department store and Gracie gets him promoted to refrigerator sales. Unfortunately, they forget to share this news with George, who unknowingly orders refrigerators for his staff.

title: The Girl Behind the Perfume Counter
description: Gracie jumps to conclusions and has everyone believing that Ronnie is dating an older woman, whom is actually his girlfriend's mother.

title: Ronnie Quits College Because His Father Goes Broke
description: In an attempt to motivate her son to finish his education, Gracie tells Ronnie that George has gone broke because he didn't go to college, but her plan backfires and Ronnie decides to quit school, get a job and support the family.

title: Christmas in Jail
description: Narrating from a prison cell, George tells the strange tale of how a string of pearls that he bought as a Christmas gift for Gracie wound up landing him in the slammer.

title: The Costume Party
description: George and Harry need a loan from banker Vanderlip to secure a business deal, so George and Gracie throw a dinner party and invite him. Ronnie suggests that it be a costume party, but when Mr. Vanderlip shows up in costume, George mistakes him for Harry's shifty brother Roger and throws him out.

title: Gracie and the Bullfighter
description: When Ronnie expresses an interest in bullfighting, Gracie and Harry Von Zell head to Tijuana to bring back a bullfighter, but Ronnie's interest quickly wanes. Meanwhile, the Mortons try to dupe George into believing Gracie has left him.

title: The Ugly Duckling
description: Gracie decides to give Ronnie's brainy friend Mildred a makeover and send them to the prom together. Meanwhile, a fight ensues when Harry Morton unintentionally insults his wife's looks; and George shows off his magic Genie.

title: The Aptitude Test
description: After Ronnie explains the aptitude test that he has recently taken, Gracie decides showbiz is the wrong career for George and he would be much happier being a farmer.

title: Going to Palm Springs
description: Ronnie Burns and his friend, Ralph, make plans to get away to Palm Springs with seven girls - and without adult supervision. Meanwhile, Harry Von Zell comes down with laryngitis.

title: The Matrimonial Bureau
description: Gracie learns that when Ronnie reaches age 21 in four months, he can get legally get married without first asking her permission, so she becomes desperate to pick out a wife for him before that time comes.

title: The Fortune Teller
description: Gracie visits a fortune teller who claims George is about to acquire vast wealth, so Gracie goes out and buys Ronnie a convertible.

title: Fighting for Happiness
description: Gracie and Blanche fight with their husbands for the joy of making up.

title: The Termites
description: Gracie wants to hire a high-priced decorator to redo the bedroom, but she doesn't want George to find out until after the work is done. In order to get George out of the house, she and Ronnie pretend the house must be fumigated to rid it of termites.

title: $15,000.00 Error
description: The Burns' decorator tells Gracie that he has an opportunity to buy an art collection for $15,000, and asks if he can receive payment early - but Gracie misunderstands and thinks she owes him 15 grand.

title: The Ring
description: Gracie is worried that George will find out that she's given her engagement ring to Ronnie for his girl, so Blanche convinces her to tell George that it fell into the kitchen sink drain.

title: The Plumber's Friend
description: Gracie agrees to watch Mr. Jantzen's four daughters while he goes to San Francisco. Meanwhile, Kathy's jealousy threatens to destroy her engagement to Ronnie.

title: Going to Houston
description: When Brian McAfee's father decides to take him out of college, Gracie, Blanche and Ronnie hop a plane to Texas to change his mind. Once George realizes what's happened, he leaves with Von Zell on his heels, convinced there's an oil deal.

title: The Stray Dog
description: While staying in a hotel in Houston, the hotel manager's French poodle follows Gracie to her room. She assumes it's a stray and wants to keep it. Guests are not allowed to keep animals in the hotel, so she and Blanche decide to hide the dog from George and the hotel staff.

title: Ronnie Gets a Movie Role
description: When Ronnie accepts a role in the film "Bernardine," Gracie fears George will be furious that their son is putting his education on the back burner, so everyone bends over backwards to cover for Ronnie.

title: The Plumber's Union
description: Gracie arranges to find a wife for Mr. Jantzen via correspondence, but she was less than truthful in her description and can't get George out of the house so the pair can meet. Meanwhile, Ronnie approaches George for acting advice.

title: Harry Returns Early
description: When Harry Morton returns from his business trip a day early, George convinces him to don a beard, sport a French accent and romance Blanche, who plays along with the gag. Gracie catches them and concludes Blanche is having an affair.

title: The Publicity Romance
description: When the publicity department sends Ronnie on a date with a new Italian movie star, it causes a rift in his relationship with Kathy, so Gracie runs interference with the movie studio.

title: The Texan Lady MacBeth
description: When Bonnie Sue comes to California to pursue an acting career, her brother Brian begs Gracie to find a way to get her to return home to Texas. Meanwhile, Ronnie's friends rib him about his movie career.

title: Ronnie's Boat
description: Ronnie wants to buy a 22-foot cabin cruiser but he needs his father's credit, so Gracie enlists her friends to convince George that it's a wise investment. Meanwhile, a man from the BBC comes to town to renew the contract for the show.

title: A Trip to Tahiti
description: Ronnie and Ralph are all set for a trip to Tahiti on Ronnie's new boat. However, when the two beautiful Jansen girls stop by, the boys realize what they'll be missing out on if they go. Since Gracie has already figured out an excuse to tell George after the boys had left, Ronnie tries to talk George into persuading Gracie that they shouldn't go.

title: The Home Graduation
description: Brian's McAfee's family arrives for his college graduation, but he mistakenly thinks he hasn't earned a diploma, so he turns to Gracie for advice and she convinces him to fake a broken leg so they can hold a phony ceremony in her home.

title: Blanche's Mother Arrives
description: Harry's business trip is canceled at the last minute, so Blanche's visiting mother is forced to stay with the Burns'. Meanwhile, Ronnie tries to impress a beautiful foreign exchange student by misspeaking the language of love.

title: A Marital Mix-Up
description: Gracie plays Cupid by trying to find a wife for their plumber, Mr. Jansen.

title: The Wading Pool at Acapulco
description: Ronnie and Ralph apply for jobs as lifeguards at an Acapulco resort, but when they learn they'll be working the kiddie pool, they decide to back out. Meanwhile, Blanche and Gracie decide Acapulco would be a perfect vacation destination.

title: A Pain in the Back
description: When Blanche tries to force Harry to take George on a fishing trip, the men mutually agree that George should fake a backache. Meanwhile, Ronnie and Ralph prepare for a calypso-themed party.

title: Ronnie's Twenty-One
description: On his 21st birthday, Marie Bordeau asks Ronnie to marry her so she can stay in the country. Meanwhile Gracie goes to get Ronnie's birth certificate changed; and George tricks Harry Von Zell into doing his chores.

title: The General
description: Identity confusion abounds when Gracie meddles in the lives of a stoic general and his son, who's about to be enlisted in the military. Meanwhile George and Harry shamelessly jump aboard the TV western bandwagon.

title: Too Much Pot Roast
description: Gracie intervenes when she learns Ronnie's been gawking at pretty classmates and ignoring his teachers. Meanwhile, Harry von Zell pleads with George to let him do a western skit; and the Mortons quarrel over their redundant meals.

title: The Texan Italian
description: Ronnie's girlfriend, Bonnie Sue, fears her Texan drawl will hinder her from landing a movie role, so Gracie reshapes her image into that of an Italian starlet named Tina Cacciatore.

title: An English Tea
description: Gracie passes off Harry Morton as her husband to impress the mother of an English girl whom Ronnie is dating. Meanwhile, Harry Von Zell makes another attempt to sell George on the idea of doing a western skit.

title: September and May
description: After June Jantzen seeks advice about her father, whom she mistakenly thinks is dating a woman half his age, Gracie concludes that Ronnie's newest girlfriend is cavorting with all of the older men in the neighborhood.

title: The Star Maker
description: Gracie attempts to raise Bonnie Sue's brother's grades by getting the smartest boy in class to take his name.

title: The African Hunter
description: When a swooning Gracie invites a game hunter to spend the week at the house, George concocts a bizarre scheme to scare him away.

title: One Little Fight
description: Ronnie and Ralph have a brief falling out over a girl, so Gracie, oblivious to the fact that the boys have already made up, stages a huge fight with Blanche to show him how silly it is to quarrel with one's best friend.

title: With or Without Glasses
description: Gracie convinced Alfred that his glasses were ruining his movie-star looks, but his refusal to wear them has disrupted his studies, so she attempts to set things right. Meanwhile, Ronnie thinks he's flunking out of school.

title: A Box of Cigars
description: To win votes for Ralph's homecoming queen girlfriend, Gracie decides to give away George's cigars, so she enlists a hapless Harry Von Zell as an accomplice. Meanwhile, a befuddled repairman works to fix George's broken TV.

title: Misery Loves Company
description: Gracie manages to complicate matters when she meddles in Ralph's and Ronnie's love lives.

title: A Hole in the Carpet
description: After Gracie suffers a fall in public, the department store is eager to make restitution, but she thinks that she has to pay for their damaged carpet.

title: The Old Mink Coat
description: Gracie and Blanche are upset when they find out what their husbands are getting them for Christmas, so they scheme to get mink coats. But George gets wind of their plan and makes sure that an old raccoon coat is part of the plot.

title: Invitation to the Party
description: Gracie uses her talent for deception to finagle an invitation to a swank New Year's Eve party for the Mortons. Meanwhile, Ronnie decides to attend a costume ball; and Harry Von Zell becomes convinced that George is trying to dupe him.

title: The Stolen Car
description: When Ronnie needs a good story for the college newspaper, Gracie lands a scoop by helping Brian McAfee steal his own car. Meanwhile, Blanche and Gracie concoct a plan to get their husbands to fund full home redecorations.

title: Ronnie Finds a Friend an Apartment
description: Gracie unknowingly kidnaps a baby, which she mistakenly believes to be Ronnie's son.

title: McAfee and the Manicurist
description: Bonnie Sue is worried because her 65-year-old father wants to marry a 25-year old hotel manicurist whom he met just met.

title: Too Many Fathers
description: To impress his girlfriend's parents, Gracie pretends to be Jerry's mother, but she has difficulty finding someone to commit to masquerading as his father.

title: The Accident
description: Harry Morton is furious that he's tainted his perfect driver safety record with a traffic accident, so he counts on passenger Gracie to prove he was not at fault.

title: The Japanese Texan
description: Gracie tries to help Bonnie Sue land the leading role in a movie by inviting the director to a fictional-anniversary dinner. George discovers the scheme and creates confusion by declaring it really is the 10th anniversary of some event.

title: Hypnotizing Gracie
description: After falling under the spell of a hypnotist, Harry Morton falls in love with his wife, Harry von Zell becomes a barking dog and Gracie is transformed into a genius.

title: Gracie Is Brilliant
description: Now that Gracie has been hypnotized into becoming the smartest woman in the world, she starts winning quiz shows, while George is demoted to taking care of the household chores. Meanwhile, Blanche is hypnotized into having a mind like the old Gracie.

title: Ronnie's Fan Club
description: Young Edie Westrope writes Ronnie a letter saying that she wants to start a fan club for him, but identity confusion escalates when her older sister arrives on the doorstep and Ronnie decides to ask her for a date.

title: Frozen Passion
description: 'Frozen Passion' is the title of a script that George has rejected. Unaware of this, Gracie attempts to cast her friends and family in various roles of the film.

title: High Blood Pressure
description: Gracie decides to help Mr. Jantzen pass a life insurance medical exam. Meanwhile, George attempts to get out of the house to play a round of golf with his buddies.

title: Softening the Professor
description: Spring is in the air, which means Ronnie and Ralph cut class, and Blanche tries to get Harry in a romantic mood.

title: The Publicity Marriage
description: When a 13-year-old girl becomes enamored with Ronnie, Gracie plants a fake story in the newspaper announcing his marriage to Bonnie Sue.

title: Blanche Gets a Jury Notice
description: Harry's scheme to get Blanche on a jury backfires. Gracie volunteers for jury duty. Ronnie tries to use reverse-psychology to juggle his relationships with two girls who want to enter show business.

title: Gracie and the Jury
description: Gracie inadvertently passes evidence - a counterfeit $20 bill - to Blanche so she can buy the hat Gracie wants before the store closes. Ronnie's plan to thwart Vera's show business aspirations backfires when George hires her.

title: Ronnie Makes a Record
description: When George helps Ronnie land a deal with Verve Records, Gracie thinks the youth-oriented label has spurned George in favor of their son.

title: Ronnie's Royalty Check
description: When a young singer accompanies Ronnie to the store to buy his mother a gift, Gracie assumes she's after his money.

title: A Visit from Charles Vidor
description: Charles Vidor asks George to coerce Jack Benny to emcee a dinner gala. Meanwhile, Gracie stirs up publicity for Bonnie Sue in hopes that it will lead to a role for the young ingnue in Vidor's next film.

title: Ronnie Goes Into the Army
description: Ronnie receives his draft notice into the Army, so Gracie establishes a military regimen in the Burns household. Meanwhile, Harry von Zell is sure he can talk George into letting him have Ronnie's old room, rent-free.

title: Locked Out
description: In an attempt to help her family, Gracie upsets George's dealings with a television executive and almost breaks up Ronnie's romance with a hat-check girl. George feels it's the last straw when Gracie also loses the house key.

title: The Week in New York
description: All are affected when Gracie spontaneously makes travel reservations, so George systematically destroys everyone's plans.

title: The June Wedding
description: Everyone is having various romantic problems and it doesn't help matters that Gracie has invited a young couple to spend their honeymoon with the family.

title: Summer School
description: Ronnie's plans to spend the summer with his actor's stock company at the Big Bear Lodge are disrupted when his father learns that Ronnie is flunking Ancient History. George demands that Ronnie attend summer school, but Gracie has another idea or two of her own.

title: The Grammar School Dance
description: Ronnie's plans are disrupted by a fan whom he once promised to escort to a school dance. Meanwhile Harry Von Zell tries to weasel out of his wedding engagement; and Harry Morton thinks his wife has taken a young lover.

title: The Exchange Student
description: An exchange student from France moves into the Burns household and upsets the harmony within. Harry von Zell comes up with a plan to get rid of him.
